resources.string:
In order to connect to your node, Thunder needs to know its .onion address.

Here is how you can generate a QR code containing your node's address on RaspiBlitz:

qrencode -t utf8 < /mnt/hdd/tor/clnGRPCport/hostname

You also need to scan a TLS certificate of your node.

RaspiBlitz example:

qrencode -t utf8 < /home/bitcoin/.lightning/bitcoin/server.pem

Your node won't accept connections from clients if they don't have a special client certificate.

RaspiBlitz example:

qrencode -t utf8 < /home/bitcoin/.lightning/bitcoin/client.pem

You should also add a private key for your client certificate.

RaspiBlitz example:

qrencode -t utf8 < /home/bitcoin/.lightning/bitcoin/client-key.pem
